action.action-desc: Mr. Harder of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 to require States to consider measures that limit the amount of retail utility rate increases a utility company can request to once every 365 days.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop the Rate Hikes Act.

section.header: Consideration of measures to cap retail utility rate increases to once a year
section.text: Section 111(d) of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 (16 U.S.C. 2621(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Cap on retail utility rate increases to once a year
paragraph.text: Each electric utility shall request no more than one rate increase once per year.
